vision.notes: Likely present, though potentially adapted to low-light conditions in deep waters. Size of eye and visual acuity not specified in provided documents.

electroreception.notes: Present in sharks generally. Detects electrical fields produced by other organisms.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system detects vibrations and pressure changes in the water.

chemoreception.notes: Olfaction and taste; used for detecting chemical cues in the water.

bioluminescence.notes: Light-producing photophores present on their bodies. Used for communication, camouflage, or attracting prey.
